content.description: Hard moves past the second bolt get you to the hand jam and clipping the third. Get into the open book with side pulls, underclings and stemming and struggle through more hard moves. Gabe found rough description of this route in the Prescott College Library.
content.location: On the right side of the feature.

content.description: Head up the rough and slightly painful crack that's right in the middle of The Tooth. A couple newer looking bolts protect the face above to get to the anchor. It protects fine and is pretty innocuous, but it's a crack climb and is there.
content.protection: A few cams and some draws.

content.description: A stemming first move, some delicate footwork through the crux around the second bolt, past the right trending seam and past more bolts to the top. Grainy rock, some good movement and the crux is between first and second bolts.
content.location: Just to the right of the Crack. Bolts are obvious. Climbs to the right anchor up top.

content.description: Committing move right off the boulder to clip the first bolt. Climb grainy rock up the arete past some well-placed bolts that protect the climb safely to a two bolt anchor on the top of the feature. Rock is friable and needs some traffic to clean it up some. Climb carefully.
content.location: On the left side of The Tooth. Belay from the top of a rock.

content.description: Another small crag that isn't affected by the peregrine closure and offers 4 established routes and the opportunity for some new development. It's a fun afternoon jaunt with nice views of the mountain and the surrounding rocks, etc. Not really a destination crag, just something fun to explore while in the area during the closure season.
